extension.name: Simple Email Form
extension.author: joomla.unlikelysource.org
extension.description:
A simple email form from unlikelysource.com with up to 8 fields + Joomla CAPTCHA + 32 languages.
Version 2.3.0 -- works on Joomla 3.x.
REQUIRES a web server running at a minimum PHP 5.3!!!
TO LOAD IN AN ARTICLE (most common):
  • In the Details box, modify Position to user99 (or whatever).
  • In your target article, add this line: {loadposition user99}.
  • Make sure Extensions - Plugin Manager - Content - Load Module is active.

field.description: Choose the default form type

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_defaultLang
field.label: Default Language (Classic)
field.description: Choose the default language

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailTo
field.label: Send Results To
field.description: Send results to this email address. If more than one, separate with commas or spaces.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_labelAlign
field.label: Label Alignment
field.description: Choose to have the labels aligned LEFT,RIGHT, or CENTER

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1active
field.label: Activate Field 1
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to activate field 1 and 'R' to activate and make it required. Enter 'H' to make the field hidden (appears in email automatically).

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1label
field.label: Label for Field 1
field.description: The label for the 1st optional field which will appear in your email form.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1value
field.label: Default Value for Field 1
field.description: Enter the default value for this field, or hit the spacebar for no default. If this field is a drop-down select, radio button, or checkbox field, enter options separated by commas as follows: return1=visible1,return2=visible2 (where 'returnX' = value returned when selected and 'visibleX' = what is visible onscreen. If this field remains as the 'From' field, the value entered here will be used if email checking is disabled or if there is no email address supplied by the website visitor.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1size
field.label: Display Size of Field 1
field.description: The size of the 1st optional field which will appear in your email form. If textarea, enter value as n,n (rows,cols). If field is Radio / Checkbox size is width in pixels. Set to 0 to suppress this width, which allows the CSS class to determine appearance.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1maxx
field.label: Maximum Length of Field 1
field.description: The maximum number of characters allowed in this field.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1from
field.label: Field Type
field.description: Select 'From' if you want this field to be the 'From' text field, 'Subject' if you want this to be the subject text field, 'Normal' for a normal text field, 'Textarea' for a textarea (i.e. a box), 'Drop' for a drop-down select box, 'Radio' for radio buttons, and 'Checkbox' for check boxes. PLEASE NOTE: 'User Defined' type will be removed in 2.1.0!

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1ckRfmt
field.label: Field 1 Format
field.description: If field is radio buttons or checkboxes, enter the Format. Horizontal format is table/row/col/col/col; Vertical format is table/row/col/col/row/col/col. Use CSS (default) assumes you will use CSS.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_field1ckRpos
field.label: Field 1 Before/After
field.description: If field is radio buttons or checkboxes, is label Before or After?

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_instance
field.label: Form Instance
field.description: Set this field to a unique number if using more than one Simple Email Form on one page.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailCC
field.label: Send Results CC
field.description: Send a CC email of results to this email address. If more than one, separate with commas or spaces.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailBCC
field.label: Send Results BCC
field.description: Send a BCC email of results to this email address. If more than one, separate with commas or spaces.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailReplyTo
field.label: Reply To this address
field.description: Direct replies to this email address.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_replytoActive
field.label: Activate Reply To
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want a 'Reply-To' field to appear when the email sent.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_autoreset
field.label: Auto Reset Fields (Classic)
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want all form fields to be automatically reset (cleared) after successful form submission.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_cssClass
field.label: Name of CSS Class
field.description: Enter the name of a CSS class to use with the form. Creates xxx_table, xxx_row, xxx_th, xxx_td classes and xxx_input inside form where xxx = your CSS class. Default is 'mod_sef'.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_col2space
field.label: Space After Labels
field.description: Enter the amount of space between the label and the input field in pixels.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_redirectURL
field.label: Redirect URL
field.description: Enter the URL you wish to redirect to after successful form submission. NOTE: leave blank to NOT redirect!

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_useCaptcha
field.label: Use Captcha
field.description: To use a 'Captcha' to foil spammers, select 'I' for an image captcha (requires additional configuration), or 'T' for a text captcha. NOTE : JForm version will use the CAPTCHA module that is activated in your Joomla installation!

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaDir
field.label: Directory to Write Captchas (Classic)
field.description: Enter the absolute directory path where the module can write 'captchas' (i.e. /var/www/application/images).

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaURL
field.label: URL for Captcha Directory (Classic)
field.description: Enter a URL which corresponds with the Captcha Directory (above).

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaLen
field.label: Captcha Word Length (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha word length (number of characters).

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaSize
field.label: Captcha Font Size (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha font size.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaWidth
field.label: Captcha Width (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha width in pixels.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaHeight
field.label: Captcha Height (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha height in pixels.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaTxtColor
field.label: Captcha Text Color (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha text color.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaLinesColor
field.label: Captcha Lines Color (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha lines color.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_captchaBgColor
field.label: Captcha Background Color (Classic)
field.description: Enter the desired Captcha background color.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_errorTxtColor
field.label: Error Text Color
field.description: Enter the desired HTML text color for errors.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_successTxtColor
field.label: Success Text Color
field.description: Enter the desired HTML text color for success.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_anchor
field.label: Name of Anchor Tag
field.description: Enter the name of any anchor tags associated with the form. When form is submitted, redirects back to this anchor.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_uploadActive
field.label: Number of Upload Fields
field.description: Enter a number greater than 0 which represents how many file upload fields you want to have for email attachments.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_uploadLabel
field.label: Upload Field Label
field.description: Enter a label for the file upload fields (if any).

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_uploadAllowed
field.label: Allowed Attachment Filenames
field.description: Enter a list of allowed filename extensions separated by commas. Example: if you want jpg,png, or gif, then enter 'jpg,png,gif'. Leave blank to allow ANY type of file.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_uploadRequired
field.label: Are upload fields required?
field.description: Select 'Y' if upload fields are to be required for valid form submission.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailFile
field.label: Directory to Save Attachments
field.description: Enter the absolute directory path for email attachment files.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_copymeLabel
field.label: Send Me an Email Field Label
field.description: The label for the Send Me an Email Field.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_copymeActive
field.label: Send Me an Email Field
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to activate a field which lets users send an email to themselves.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_copymeAuto
field.label: Send User an Email Automatically
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to send an email to users automatically.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_copymeContent
field.label: Send User a Custom Message
field.description: Enter a custom message if you want to define the contents of the send an email field. If empty, the user will receive a copy of the form values.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_emailCheck
field.label: Email Check (Classic)
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to check the 'From' email address. Set to 'N' to disable this check. If email check is disabled, the 'From' field will automatically take its value from what you entered as a default value for the 'From' field.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_addTitle
field.label: Include Article Title
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to include the Joomla article title in a hidden field, automatically added to the email.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_testMode
field.label: Test Mode
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to use the module in test mode. Set to 'N' when done testing!

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_renderingOverride
field.label: Override rendering
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to manually override the module's rendering of its output and create your own template in the tmpl/default_custom.php file.

field.name: mod_simpleemailform_stringOverride
field.label: Override strings (JForm only)
field.description: Select 'Y' if you want to use Joomla's language override to modify the module's strings manually.
